html:
In the most recent episode of the Bogleheads on Investing podcast, Rick Ferri interviewed Jonathan Clements, Jason Zweig, and Christine Benz. Together, they dig a little deeper into the Jonathan Clements Getting Going on Savings Initiative than what you’ve likely seen so far in our various articles. And they discuss Jonathan’s new book as well.

It was lovely to hear Jonathan’s own take on his career, how his writing explored different themes over time, and how that all comes into the book.

  • Bogleheads on Investing, Episode 82: Jonathan Clements, Jason Zweig, and Christine Benz

Other Recommended Reading

  • The Most Revealing Question in Personal Investing from Victor Haghani and James White
  • Using Subtrusts To Allow Stretch IRA Treatment For Trusts With Multiple Beneficiaries from Ben Henry-Moreland
  • The Dumb Money Isn’t So Dumb Anymore from Ben Carlson
  • You Can’t Put a Price on Mental Freedom from Nick Maggiulli
  • AICPA: Contingent Fee Provision in Tax Bill Would Help Unscrupulous Tax Preparers from Martha Waggoner
  • His Life Savings Were Mailed to Him by Paper Check. Now, It’s Gone from Ron Lieber

Thanks for reading!
